divs: Sighting DetailsWe had just finished eating a late dinner and were sitting at the picnic table outside of our camper. We had attended a Penn State football game that afternoon and were spending the night at their campground which was located near the agriculture compounds. I had been looking at the night shy and then I noticed what I thought, at first, was a Roman Candle. After looking at it for a second I realized several things: 1. It was not falling,it was soaring. 2. It was much larger than any Roman Candle. 3. It was a "orange-yellow" flame that was smaller at the front than the rear. The object continued to float noiselessly over the campground at a low altitude. When it had gone for about a minute it turned to the right at a sharp angle and started to gain altitude and speed. It took several minutes for it to slowly disappear. Shortly after it turned a neighboring camper came running over asking if we had seen it. He then went back and another member of his party took the attached picture using his Blackberry. I do not know if the "V" shape it actual, or if it is a result if hand movement. It did not have a shape like this to the naked eye.
trends: There have been 10 other sightings in State College
There were no other sightings in State College on or around September 18th 2010
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: fireball flew over campground, then turned right and gained altitude
